title: Canonical quotients in model theory
abstract:
We study canonical quotients in model theory, mainly stable quotients of
type-definable groups and invariant types in NIP theories. We extend the
modelling property to continuous theories and use it to study $n$-dependence in
hyperdefinable sets. Furthermore, we study maximal WAP and tame quotients of
$S_X(\mathfrak{C})$, where $\mathfrak{C}$ is a monster model of a complete
theory $T$ and $X$ is an $\emptyset$-type-definable set and show that the Ellis
groups of the maximal WAP quotient flow and the maximal tame quotient flow do
not depend on the choice of the monster model $\mathfrak{C}$.
